DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: Caroline G.L. Martins;Martins, C G L;Martins, Caroline G.L.;Martins, C.G.L.;Martins, Caroline G L;Martins, Caroline G. L.

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em fsica pela 'Universidade Estadual Paulista (Rio Claro-SP)' (Maro/2005-Dezembro/2008), obteve seu ttulo de mestre em fsica aplicada pela mesma universidade (Fevereiro/2009-Julho/2010) sobre modelagens para controle de dinmica catica com barreiras de transporte. Fez seu doutoramento em topologias de campos magnticos em tokamaks pelo 'Instituto Tecnolgico da Aeronutica' (Agosto/2010-Dezembro/2013). Fez seu ps-doutorado no 'Institute for Fusion Studies' na 'University of Texas at Austin' (Janeiro/2014-Junho/2015), onde analisou a dinmica catica em sistemas bidimensionais e multidimensionais, especialmente aplicados modelagem de plasmas confinados em tokamaks. Atualmente pesquisadora ps doutoral no 'Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica' onde analisa geometrias magnticas de divertores avanados em tokamaks. Tem experincia na rea de fsica aplicada com nfase nos seguintes temas: caos em sistemas hamiltonianos, mapeamentos discretos, modelagem para dinmica no-linear catica e fsica de plasmas.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Has experience in Physic, focusing on General Physic

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: * Atual Co-orientadora na iniciao cientfica de Jos Luciano de Morais Neto. Tpico: confinando o mar de caos e suas implicaes. Orientao de Marisa Roberto no 'Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica'. * Co-orientadora na iniciao cientfica, j finalizada, de Luis C. de Oliveira. Tpico: estruturas coerentes lagrangianas tipo toros robustos. Orientao de Marisa Roberto no 'Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica'. De 2010-2011.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Comparao da evoluo temporal do transporte de partculas em tokamaks com ou sem perturbao ressonante externa utilizando o cdigo CRONOS
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Investigaremos o transporte de partculas em toda a regio da descarga, com a utilizao do cdigo francs 'CRONOS'. Devero ser includas perturbaes externas, tais como as produzidas por um limitador magntico ergdico, de forma a criar modos ressonantes na regio perifrica da coluna de plasma. Desta forma, poderemos comparar o transporte das partculas para as descargas com perturbao ressonante e sem perturbao ressonante. Construiremos um sistema Hamiltoniano para o estudo do escape e do comportamento das linhas de campo magnticas, seguindo metodologias semelhantes de outros trabalhos j publicados pela orientadora e pelo co-orientador deste projeto. Com o resultado do transporte fornecido pelo CRONOS iremos relacionar o transporte de partculas em direo parede do tokamak com o escape das linhas de campo magnticas, com e sem perturbao ressonante.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: Caroline G.L. Martins;Martins, C G L;Martins, Caroline G.L.;Martins, C.G.L.;Martins, Caroline G L;Martins, Caroline G. L.

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Fundao de Amparo Pesquisa do Estado de So Paulo

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Transporte de linhas de campo magntico e de partculas em tokamaks
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Prope-se construir um modelo para o campo magntico do tokamak capaz de reproduzir um ponto de X (hiperblico) na parte externa do plasmas, simulando um divertor. Para isto ser usada uma configurao de fios infinitos dispostos de tal forma a gerar um ponto de X. Pretende-se, alm disso, dar continuidade ao estudo de mapa com divertor, seguindo a metodologia proposta por Morrison e Abbamonte. Finalmente, se prope investigar o transporte de partculas em tokamaks atravs de simulao computacional usando o cdigo Cronos
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Transporte de linhas de campo magntico e de partculas em tokamaks

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Estudo de dissipao e bifurcaes usando a forma normal ressonante com Toros Robustos
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Atravs da Forma Normal Ressonante com dissipao, investigamos as possibilidades de estouros de crises quando o sistema apresenta caos. Nessa situao o mar catico que existir no caso conservativo dever ser transformado num atrator catico e esse poder ser destrudo se ocorrerem crises no sistema. As crises ocorrem quando h cruzamentos de variedades. Os cruzamentos mais usuais so os homoclnicos, porm a preparao desse modelo poder levar tambm a cruzamentos heteroclnicos, pois as cadeias de ressonncias podem estar to prximas quanto queiramos.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Controle de dinmica catica com Toros Robustos
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O confinamento magntico de plasmas em tokamaks tem sido investigado para verificar a possibilidade de se construir reatores de fuso termonuclear controlada. Esse confinamento depende das configuraes do campo magntico no plasma. Muitas experincias realizadas confirmaram que o campo magntico pode ser alterado por correntes eltricas externas ressonantes, como as criadas por um limitador magntico ou um diversor, que melhoram o confinamento obtido. Embora vrios mtodos de controle das linhas caticas do campo magntico j tenham sido investigados, a criao de Toros Robustos, proposta neste projeto, ainda no foi analisada. Assim, a investigao proposta poder abrir uma perspectiva nova para o controle das linhas de campo magntico.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Interferncia de Toros Robustos na dinmica de sistemas no-lineares
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Consideraremos um sistema em que ocorrem ressonncias iscronas e que um termo adicional promove a multiplicao das rbitas peridicas. Aps a reconexo dessas ressonncias aparecem barreiras de transporte devido s curvas "meanders" que emergiram. Quando estudamos o problema com 2 ressonncias, a curva "meander" mais rgida estava associada com o menor nmero de rotao. Agora pretendemos colocar mais do que duas ressonncias iscronas no sistem, verificar o aparecimento de regies de curvas "meanders" e investigar o comportamento da correspondente curva "shearless" em relao ao nmero de rotao do sistema. Outros clculos adicionais podero ser desenvolvidos.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Interferncia de Toros Robustos na dinmica de sistemas no-lineares

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Dinmica catica em sistemas bidimensionais e multidimensionais
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A dinmica em sistemas descritos por Hamiltoniana ou por mapas discretos caticos, com duas ou mais dimenses, um tema atual e amplo de investigao em vrias reas da fsica. O presente trabalho divide-se em duas investigaes: uma para uma Hamiltoniana com um grau e meio de liberdade, e outra para um mapa simpltico de quatro dimenses. Em ambos sistemas, propem-se verificar a influncia de 'stickiness' (aderncia), associado regies no mar catico, onde as rbitas ficam presas por um certo tempo, levando o sistema a um regime sub-difusivo. Analisaremos este fenmeno em um modelo hamiltoniano de plasma confinado em tokamak com divertor poloidal e perturbaes ressonantes externas geradas por bobinas posicionadas ao redor da cmara toroidal. Este modelo hamiltoniano simula as superfcies do tokamak ITER, incluindo o ponto de X referente ao divertor poloidal. As perturbaes ressonantes so geradas atravs da incluso de boninas condutoras ao redor da cmara toroidal, similares as bobinas de correo (C-coils) instaladas no tokamak DIII-D que minimizam os efeitos gerados por assimetria nas bobinas de equilbrio. Analisaremos tambm o efeito ''stickiness'' em um mapa multidimensional, resultante do acoplamento de um mapa cbico e um mapa quadrtico, a fim de verificar a sua influncia na difuso de Arnold, bem como a compreenso de algumas caractersticas atribudas a teia de Arnold, que permeia todo o espao de fases.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Interference of robust tori on the resonance overlap
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: We study a dynamical system which describes the overlap of resonances in a global integrable context and we present a new topological scenario for the reconnection of three resonance island chains in the presence of two robust tori. These tori induce this new scenario and they play the role of transport barriers which are relevant for plasma confinement in Tokamaks.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We study a dynamical system which describes the overlap of resonances in a global integrable context and we present a new topological scenario for the reconnection of three resonance island chains in the presence of two robust tori. These tori induce this new scenario and they play the role of transport barriers which are relevant for plasma confinement in Tokamaks.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We study a dynamical system which describes the overlap of resonances in a global integrable context and we present a new topological scenario for the reconnection of three resonance island chains in the presence of two robust tori. These tori induce this new scenario and they play the role of transport barriers which are relevant for plasma confinement in Tokamaks.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: The non-twist standard map with robust tori
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: The non-twist standard map with robust tori

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Physics. A, Mathematical and Theoretical (Print)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: Caroline G.L. Martins;Martins, C G L;Martins, Caroline G.L.;Martins, C.G.L.;Martins, Caroline G L;Martins, Caroline G. L.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The non-twist standard map occurs frequently in many fields of science specially in modeling the dynamics of the magnetic field lines in tokamaks. Robust tori, dynamical barriers that impede the radial transport among different regions of the phase space, are introduced in the non-twist standard map in a conservative fashion. The resulting Non-Twist Standard Map with Robust Tori (NTRT) is an improved model to study transport barriers in plasmas confined in tokamaks.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The non-twist standard map occurs frequently in many fields of science specially in modeling the dynamics of the magnetic field lines in tokamaks. Robust tori, dynamical barriers that impede the radial transport among different regions of the phase space, are introduced in the non-twist standard map in a conservative fashion. The resulting Non-Twist Standard Map with Robust Tori (NTRT) is an improved model to study transport barriers in plasmas confined in tokamaks.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Effect of robust torus on the dynamical transport

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In the present work, we quantify the fraction of trajectories that reach a specific region of the phase space when we vary a control parameter using two symplectic maps: one non-twist and another one twist. The two maps were studied with and without a robust torus. We compare the obtained patterns and we identify the effect of the robust torus on the dynamical transport. We show that the effect of meandering-like barriers lose importance in blocking the radial transport when the robust torus is present.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Robust tori in a double-waved Hamiltonian model
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Robust tori in a double-waved Hamiltonian model

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A Hamiltonian system perturbed by two waves with particular wave numbers can present robust tori, barriers created by the vanishing of the perturbed Hamiltonian at some defined positions. When robust tori exist, any trajectory in phase space passing close to them is blocked by emergent invariant curves that prevent the chaotic transport. Our results indicate that the considered particular solution for the two waves Hamiltonian model shows plenty robust tori blocking radial transport.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A Hamiltonian system perturbed by two waves with particular wave numbers can present robust tori, barriers created by the vanishing of the perturbed Hamiltonian at some defined positions. When robust tori exist, any trajectory in phase space passing close to them is blocked by emergent invariant curves that prevent the chaotic transport. Our results indicate that the considered particular solution for the two waves Hamiltonian model shows plenty robust tori blocking radial transport.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Plasma confinement in tokamaks with robust torus

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We present a non-linear symplectic map that describes the alterations of the magnetic field lines inside the tokamak plasma due to the presence of a robust torus (RT) at the plasma edge. This RT prevents the magnetic field lines from reaching the tokamak wall and reduces, in its vicinity, the islands and invariant curve destruction due to resonant perturbations. The map describes the equilibrium magnetic field lines perturbed by resonances created by ergodic magnetic limiters (EMLs). We present the results obtained for twist and non-twist mappings derived for monotonic and non-monotonic plasma current density radial profiles, respectively. Our results indicate that the RT implementation would decrease the field line transport at the tokamak plasma edge.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Physics. A, Mathematical and Theoretical (Print)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We introduce the labyrinthic standard non-twist map, which is a modified non-twist standard map with an additional perturbation which is a period multiple of the original perturbation period. In phase space this map can present several sets of invariant meandering curves due to the reconnection process of isochrones resonances. Inside each meander set we can find a non-twist invariant curve called the shearless curve, with an extreme rotation number, which generates a wide stickiness effect in phase space when it is broken. The birth/break of these shearless curves, as well as their effects on the dynamical transport are studied, showing the formation of many transport barriers in the system.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Magnetic Field Line Escape: Comparison with Mean Free Path

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In the present work, we determine the fraction of magnetic field lines that reach the tokamak wall leaving the plasma surrounded by a chaotic layer created by resonant perturbations at the plasma edge. The chaotic layer arises in a scenario where an integrable magnetic field with reversed magnetic shear is perturbed by an ergodic magnetic limiter. For each considered line, we calculate its connection length, i.e. the number of toroidal turns that the field lines complete before reaching the wall. We represent the results in the poloidal section in which the initial coordinates are chosen. We also estimate the radial profile of the fraction of field lines, for different temperatures, whose connection lengths are smaller than the electron collisional mean free path.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Blocking Radial Diffusion in a Double-Waved Hamiltonian Model

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A non-twist Hamiltonian system perturbed by two waves with particular wave numbers can present Robust Tori, barriers created by the vanishing of the perturbing Hamiltonian at some defined positions. When Robust Tori exist, any trajectory in phase space passing close to them is blocked by emergent invariant curves that prevent the chaotic transport. We analyze the breaking up of the RT as well the transport dependence on the wave numbers and on the wave amplitudes. Moreover, we report the chaotic web formation in the phase space and how this pattern influences the transport.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Analytical solutions for Tokamak equilibria with reversed toroidal current
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Analytical solutions for Tokamak equilibria with reversed toroidal current

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In tokamaks, an advanced plasma confinement regime has been investigated with a central hollow electric current with negative density which gives rise to non-nested magnetic surfaces. We present analytical solutions for the magnetohydrodynamic equilibria of this regime in terms of non-orthogonal toroidal polar coordinates. These solutions are obtained for large aspect ratio tokamaks and they are valid for any kind of reversed hollow current density profiles. The zero order solution of the poloidal magnetic flux function describes nested toroidal magnetic surfaces with a magnetic axis displaced due to the toroidal geometry. The first order correction introduces a poloidal field asymmetry and, consequently, magnetic islands arise around the zero order surface with null poloidal magnetic flux gradient. An analytic expression for the magnetic island width is deduced in terms of the equilibrium. parameters. We give examples of the equilibrium plasma profiles and islands obtained for a class of current density profile

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In general the term ??Lagrangian coherent structure?? (LCS) is used to make reference about structures whose properties are similar to a time-dependent analog of stable and unstable manifolds from a hyperbolic fixed point in Hamiltonian systems. Recently, the term LCS was used to describe a different type of structure, whose properties are similar to those of invariant tori in certain classes of two-dimensional incompressible flows. A new kind of LCS was obtained. It consists of barriers, called robust tori that block the trajectories in certain regions of the phase space. We used the Double-Gyre Flow system as the model. In this system, the robust tori play the role of a skeleton for the dynamics and block, horizontally, vortices that come from different parts of the phase space.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Set of wires to simulate tokamaks with poloidal divertor
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Set of wires to simulate tokamaks with poloidal divertor

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Simple wires model have been proposed to simulate magnetic configurations in tokamaks. Here, we consider electric currents in five parallel infinite wires to obtain double-null magnetic surfaces with specific choices of magnetic axis positions, triangularity and elongation. As an example, we choose the position and the electric current of each wire to obtain magnetic surfaces similar to those expected in the tokamak ITER. Moreover, we also integrate the perturbed field line differential equation to simulate chaotic layers near the hyperbolic points and deposition patterns, at the divertor plate, observed in tokamaks. To simulate that, we add to the model a perturbing error field, due to asymmetries in the tokamak coils, and introduce a random collisional term to the field line mapping to reproduce escape pattern alterations due to particle collisions
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Simple wires model have been proposed to simulate magnetic configurations in tokamaks. Here, we consider electric currents in five parallel infinite wires to obtain double-null magnetic surfaces with specific choices of magnetic axis positions, triangularity and elongation. As an example, we choose the position and the electric current of each wire to obtain magnetic surfaces similar to those expected in the tokamak ITER. Moreover, we also integrate the perturbed field line differential equation to simulate chaotic layers near the hyperbolic points and deposition patterns, at the divertor plate, observed in tokamaks. To simulate that, we add to the model a perturbing error field, due to asymmetries in the tokamak coils, and introduce a random collisional term to the field line mapping to reproduce escape pattern alterations due to particle collisions

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Communications in Nonlinear Science & Numerical Simulation

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We review symplectic nontwist maps that we have introduced to describe Lagrangian transport properties in magnetically confined plasmas in tokamaks. These nontwist maps are suitable to describe the formation and destruction of transport barriers in the shearless region (i.e., near the curve where the twist condition does not hold). The maps can be used to investigate two kinds of problems in plasmas with non-monotonic field profiles: the first is the chaotic magnetic field line transport in plasmas with external resonant perturbations. The second problem is the chaotic particle drift motion caused by electrostatic drift waves. The presented analytical maps, derived from plasma models with equilibrium field profiles and control parameters that are commonly measured in plasma discharges, can be used to investigate long-term transport properties.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Magnetic Field Line Stickiness in Tokamaks

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: Caroline G.L. Martins;Martins, C G L;Martins, Caroline G.L.;Martins, C.G.L.;Martins, Caroline G L;Martins, Caroline G. L.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Fsica de Plasmas e Descargas Eltricas

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Delineating the magnetic field line escape pattern and stickiness in a poloidally diverted tokamak

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: Caroline G.L. Martins;Martins, C G L;Martins, Caroline G.L.;Martins, C.G.L.;Martins, Caroline G L;Martins, Caroline G. L.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Fsica dos Fludos, Fsica de Plasmas e Descargas Eltricas
AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Fsica de Plasmas e Descargas Eltricas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We analyze a Hamiltonian model with five wire loops that delineates magnetic surfaces of tokamaks with poloidal divertor. Non-axisymmetric magnetic perturbations are added by external coils, similar to the correction coils that have been installed or designed in present tokamaks. To show the influence of magnetic perturbations on the field line escape, we integrate numerically the field line differential equations and obtain the footprints and deposition patterns on the divertor plate. Moreover, we show that the homoclinic tangle describes the deposition patterns in the divertor plate, agreeing with results observed in sophisticated simulation codes. Additionally, we show that while chaotic lines escape to the divertor plates, some of them are trapped, for many toroidal turns, in complex structures around magnetic islands, embedded in the chaotic region, giving rise to stickiness evidences characteristic of chaotic Hamiltonian systems. Finally, we introduce a random collisional term to the field line mapping to investigate stickiness alterations due to particle collisions. Within this model, we conclude that, even reduced by collisions, the observed trapping still influences the field line transport. The results obtained for our numerical estimations indicate that the reported trapping may affect the transport in present tokamaks.
